subject: History
title: The US Civil Rights Movement
description: One-minute skill: The US Civil Rights Movement.

hook.text: In 1955, a tired seamstress refused to give up her bus seat. Her arrest sparked a movement that changed America.

buildup.text: Rosa Parks's arrest ignited the Montgomery Bus Boycott. Martin Luther King Jr. emerged as its young leader.

discovery.text: King's 'I Have a Dream' speech at the 1963 March on Washington moved millions and pressured Congress to act.

climax.text: Legal segregation ended, but economic and social inequality persisted. The dream remains unfinished.

punchline.text: A bus seat changed a nation's lawsâ€”not yet its heart.
